name: B. Producing Snow
statement:
Alice likes snow a lot! Unfortunately, this year’s winter is already
over, and she can’t expect to have any more of it. Bob has thus bought
her a gift a large snow maker. He plans to make some amount of snow
every day. On day he will make a pile of snow of volume and put it in
her garden.Each day, every pile will shrink a little due to melting.
More precisely, when the temperature on a given day is , each pile will
reduce its volume by . If this would reduce the volume of a pile to or
below zero, it disappears forever. All snow piles are independent of
each other. Note that the pile made on day already loses part of its
volume on the same day. In an extreme case, this may mean that there are
no piles left at the end of a particular day.You are given the initial
pile sizes and the temperature on each day. Determine the total volume
of snow melted on each day.
